T03: Test cases: Functions
 Test statements that return functions (including the @check tag)
Learner name:
   [your name]
Initial variables:
   g <- function(x) {return(x+1)}
Checking code:
   6/6 complete. Good work! 😀
a: ✔ atomic [1]: 11
     Your code:
       t01 <- g(10)
     Expected:
       t01 <- g(10) # A: 11
b: ✔ funct: function() {...}
     Your code:
       what_is_pi <- function() {
     return(pi)
   }
     Expected:
       what_is_pi <- function() {
     return(pi)
   }
c: ✔ funct: function(x) {...}
     Your code:
       squared <- function(arg1) {
     s <- arg1^2
     return(s)
   }
     Expected:
       squared <- function(x) {
     t <- x^2
     return(t)
   }
d: ✔ atomic [1]: 10000
     Your code:
       t02 <- squared(100)
     Expected:
       t02 <- squared(100)
e: ✔ funct: function(arg_one, arg_two) {...}
     Your code:
       f1 <- function(p1, p2) {
     return(p1 == p2)
   }
     Expected:
       f1 <- function(arg_one, arg_two) {
     return(arg_one == arg_two)
   }
f: ✔ funct: function(arg1, precision) {...}
     Your code:
       h <- function(num, prec) {
     rounded <- round(num + pi, prec)
     return(rounded)
   }
     Expected:
       h <- function(arg1, precision) {
     t <- round(arg1 + pi, precision)
     return(t)
   }

 Correct: 1 - 2 - 3 - 4 - 5 - 6
 Incorrect:
